quest.name: Cross-fist Training
journal: Widargelt has a plan for expansion.

While Widargelt is pleased with his growing membership of students, there are villagers still who doubt the authenticity of his style. In order to win them over, he plans to host a cross-discipline match pitting monks against pugilists. As a well-known face among the Pugilists' Guild, you have been tasked with delivering the invitation. Make your way to Ul'dah and broach the subject with Hamon.

You arrive at the Pugilists' Guild to find not only Hamon and Chuchuto, but Rurukuta as well, temporarily returned from his wanderings. All are responsive to the idea of a cross-discipline match, and the guildmaster formally accepts. Make your way back to Ala Gannha and inform Widargelt of the pugilists' coming.
Widargelt is ecstatic to learn that Hamon has accepted the invitation, and he sets about preparing for the match. He bids you meet him directly in the Fringes at Schism, the chosen venue.
No sooner do you arrive at Schism than cries ring out from the river─D'zentsa and O'tchakha are in danger. Hasten after Widargelt to their aid.

You find Widargelt on his knees, handily bested by a band of men led by the mysterious Theobald, who claims to be the Griffin and the rightful King of Ala Mhigo both. He issues a stern warning against reviving the Fist of Rhalgr, and goes on to reveal that Widargelt is in fact his cousin, Theodred, who was raised at the Temple of the Fist in order to spare him the King of Ruin's wrath. Theobald then leaves, but not before declaring his intent to rule Ala Mhigo with an iron fist. With the immediate danger passed, you may turn your attention to your comrades.

In light of recent events, Widargelt has no choice but to call off the match, and he apologetically sends Hamon and his crew back to Ul'dah. While Widargelt checks on his pupils, take word of these troubling developments to Erik, now returned to Ala Gannha from his fieldwork.

Erik is unable to hide his shock at your report. The veracity of Theobald's words aside, the professor posits that his minions are members of the Corpse Brigade─elite soldiers trained in counter-monk combat, who once served Theodoric as his personal guard. Erik promises to investigate the many claims made, and bids you look in on Widargelt.

You find Widargelt deeply discouraged, not only by the sound drubbing he received but also the shocking revelation of his origin. For now, give your brother monk the time and space he requires.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with Hamon at the Pugilists' Guild.
Report to Widargelt in Ala Gannha.
Speak with Erik in Ala Gannha.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You look well, sisterbrother. Stronger than when last we spoke.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our membership, too, grows stronger. Word spread after the speech. Others have come to learn. But it is too soon to be satisfied.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I would welcome more to the faith. But there are villagers still who doubt us. Our authenticity and our purpose.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To convince them, I would demonstrate our techniques. In real combat, by way of a cross-discipline match.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: For our opponents, I have the pugilists of Ul'dah in mind. Assuming they are willing.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are well known in the Pugilists' Guild. If you ask, they will surely listen.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Will you speak with them on our behalf?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You have my thanks. Go well, Forename. And my regards to Master Hamon.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: A thousand push-ups and a thousand squats─that's reasonable to begin with, right?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I hope Zentsa does not scare our new pupils away with her unreasonable expectations...

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Oho! If it isn't a familiar face, and one I'm rather fond of!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Chuchuto, Rurukuta! We have an esteemed guest!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Forename! Gods, how long has it been?

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: Well, well, it seems I picked a good time to take a break from my wanderings. It's good to see you again.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: That it is! Now then, what brings you here, lasslad?

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: A cross-discipline match? Why, that sounds exciting! Don't you agree, Master?

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: <mumble> Gyr Abania so far... As well be the other side of the world... <grumble> Mostly sinewy Highlanders... And male ones at that...

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Oh, that's rich coming from a sinewy Highlander, and a wrinkled old one at that!

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: I, for one, would welcome the challenge. I was growing weary of pummeling Chuchuto senseless.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Says the one on a losing streak!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: But of course we'll go. After all you've done for us, it's the least we could do.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: The sooner the better, I take it, and there's no time like the present. We'll head out at once.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Hurry up and pack your things. We're going to Gyr Abania!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: You go on ahead, lasslad, and let young Widargelt know to expect us. It's on like an Ala Mhigan monk!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I look forward to Master Hamon's response.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The pugilists are on their way? Rhalgr be praised!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There is much to do. I will make the match known to the villagers. D'zentsa, O'tchakha, be on hand to receive our guests.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And you, Forename. Schism. That is to be the venue. Pray take yourself there and prepare.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: I've been keeping at my training, regained much of my former strength. Still a long way off from my Holyfist days, to be sure, but no matter─I've got years ahead of me! Ohohoho!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Rurukuta acts all nonchalant, but he's the keenest of us all. Hmph, some things never change!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are here. Good. The people of Ala Gannha expect a quality match. Let us not disappoint them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Soon, the girls will arrive with the pugilists. I also told the professor. But he will not attend. Science before savagery, he says.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: (-O'tchakha-)Aaaaaah!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: (-D'zentsa-)Seven hells! What are you─ Urrrgh!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! They are in trouble!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The voices came from the river! With me, Forename!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <pant> My techniques... They have no effect...

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: (-Masked Man-)Hahaha...

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: (-Masked Man-)Well, well... We thought we knew every ilm of your style. But you, adventurer─you are not like the others.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <gasp> You are the Griffin... The wretch who led countless soldiers to their doom. Good men and women with lives ahead of them. <pant> But...you are supposed to be dead.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: (-Masked Man-)The wretch who died was but a double, and good riddance, too, for he presumed to have ambitions of his own. I am the true Griffin. And my true name is Theobald, Theodoric's heir and rightful King of Ala Mhigo!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Theodoric's heir? King of Ala Mhigo?

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Aye, and in my royal duty, I have come to deliver a warning. Such cults as propagate false beliefs will not be suffered under my reign. Cease any foolish notion of reviving the Fist of Rhalgr. Swear fealty unto me, or you will meet the same end as your treacherous forebears.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Lies! Theodoric's line is spent! And rightful or no, none would bow before you! The people will not suffer another tyrant!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: You wound me, Widargelt. Or should I say...Theodred, dear cousin.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Hahaha! All this time and you didn't know? Neither who you are, nor what became of your parents? This ignorance cannot be borne. Nay, we must rectify it at once. You see, your father and mother─they conspired to betray the royal house. For their crimes, His Grace, my father, put them to death.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: And though your parents were the dimmest of traitors, they had wits enough to know when the game was over. So they sent their precious Theodred, then but a bawling babe, to be raised in safety at the Temple of the Fist. Though my father tended to that squalid little place soon enough.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Y-You dare mock my parents and my home!? Who you claim to be, I care not! I will make you pay!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Have you learned nothing? Your techniques are useless against us. If your defeat suffices not to convince you, look to the proof of your beloved temple's destruction.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Listen well. Ala Mhigo needs a strong ruler─an absolute ruler─to smite her enemies and restore her to glory. That ruler is me. Your feeble Fist has no place in her future.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is not a good time for the match. With apologies to Master Hamon, I must call it off.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha. Pray return to Ala Gannha and rest.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I shall remain behind to receive our guests. Wait with me, Forename.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Whew! Sorry for the delay, my friends. Having been here once before, I thought I had a handle on the route, but 'twas the route that had a handle on me! Hohoho!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Is something the matter?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Aye... Harsh truths have been thrust before me. Calling my very existence into question. As I am, I am no fit opponent for you and yours.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Master Hamon. Far as you have come, it pains me to say this. But I must call off our match.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Well, that you don't do so lightly is plain to see. Whatever has happened must be serious indeed.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: For now, my boy, you'd best focus on yourself. There'll be another time to trade blows.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Come, you two. We're going home.

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: Already!? We've barely gotten here, and by the scenic route besides. Let me rest a moment, will you?

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Oh, don't be such a milksop! With all your roaming, surely this distance is nothing to you!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: And Widargelt? To make it clear, we're merely postponing the match. Whatever it is that ails you now, I have faith that you'll bounce back, ready to match me blow for blow.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Master Hamon is a soul of kindness. I have nothing but gratitude.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Let us return to Ala Gannha. I must look in on D'zentsa and O'tchakha. Meanwhile, please find Professor Erik. Tell him all that has come to pass.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Young Widargelt wants to revive the Fist of Rhalgr, isn't that right? A noble mission, but far from simple, as I'm sure you already know. But when the going gets tough, you have to keep believing─in your cause, and in each other. And if ever you need extra pairs of fists, you can call upon us any time.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: If there's anything we can do, anything at all, you just let us know.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: What!? Let me paraphrase: you are telling me that Widargelt─our Widargelt, the lumbering slab─is in fact Theodred, nephew to Theodoric, the King of Ruin...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And that this man who claims to be the Griffin─presumed dead─also claims to be Theobald, Theodoric's rightful heir─also presumed dead. By the gods, not even a drink-addled bard could make this up.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Outlandish details aside, I have an inkling as to the identity of those who set upon you. They are the selfsame crew that razed the Temple of the Fist: the Corpse Brigade. Trained in counter-monk combat, they served the King of Ruin as his personal guard─though personal agents of destruction would be more accurate. But when their liege fell, they followed in their turn, becoming overqualified bandits.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Even so, it appears they have not entirely forgotten their training. That would explain why, for all their mastery of the Fist, Widargelt and the girls had no answer to them. That you could hold your own, I believe, is due to your pugilistic background.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: At any rate, now is the time to arm ourselves with knowledge. First of all, I shall look into Theobald's myriad claims. As for you, I suggest that you check on your friend. Knowing the oaf, he will be confused and crestfallen to no end.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Please find Professor Erik. Tell him all that has come to pass.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ah, it is you...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have known defeat. Tasted my fair share. But not like this. I was helpless as a babe.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: “The strength to protect,” I proclaimed. But I could not even protect my own. All my years of training. All useless. What have I to offer the people?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text:
And to think...the mad king is my uncle. I am nephew to the man who murdered my parents. Who destroyed our temple. Who brought our nation to ruin.
...Forgive me, sisterbrother. I would be alone.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A training manikin of Ala Mhigan make has been set in the ground.
